p: Phenolic acids are nonflavonoid polyphenolic compounds of benzoic acid and cinnamic acid. Major phenolic acids, which are isolated from tissues of B. aegyptiaca, include caffeic acid ( 1), ferulic acid ( 2), gentisic acid ( 3), p-coumaric acid ( 4), sinapic acid ( 5), syringic acid ( 6), vanillic acid ( 7), 2-methoxy-4-vinylphenol ( 8), 2,6-dimethoxyphenol ( 9), 2-methoxy-3(-2-propenyl)-phenol ( 10), 2-methoxy-4-(1-propenyl)-phenol ( 11), 2,4-di-tert-butyl-phenol ( 12), 2,6-di-tert-butyl-phenol ( 13) and 3-hydroxy-1-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)-1-propanone ( 14) ( Table 5; Figure 2) [ 2, 17, 18, 19].
